Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 02:23AM adhock wrote: I am half-way through Savi therapy and I must concur with the posts about doctors' blinders when it comes to this treatment. I have found it to be quite painful. Plus, the revolving door of nurses, doctors, etc. (yes, I am doing this over the holidays) have added to the discomfort. I've even received conflicting guidance from on-call docs (when I had an emergency over the holidays). I would never do this again and am very sorry that I wasn't more forceful in disagreeing with my docs on this and opting for the traditional treatment. It's a shame that there isn't more time to "research" these issues. I think that if the docs, themselves, underwent the treatment, they'd be much more circumspect in promoting it.
Posts.Title: SAVI Brachytherapy Alotte Dfarm13
